subtasks.hazard: HANDHELD 60MM: OVERLOADING ON CHARGE, THUMB OVER TOP OF BARREL, DOUBLE FEED

values: RSO/OIC, SL, AB, and Gunner will validate prior to firing correct cheese charge amount is being used (No more than charge 1). AG and SL will confirm Gunners thumb is not over the barrel, the AG and AB will strictly take commands from the Gunner to control the flow of rounds and fire rate. The AG will not receive more than one round at a time from the AB in order to reduce the risk of a double feed.

Gunner is the leader on the weapon system. They strictly control the flow of rounds, validating the charge before hanging it, the mortar tube is set to 'Trigger' prior to firing and validates the correct charge level is being used.
OIC, RSO, SL, FDC, AG, Gunner, AB

draw.overall_supervision_plan: I assess the overall initial risk to be medium as a result of an unlikely probability of a catastrophic event; I assess the overall residual risk to be low due to an unlikely probability of a critical event.Most Dangerous Risk: Misfire or Short RoundMitigation: Rehearse Misfire Procedures prior to executing TBL V and VI, senior leaders will be the individuals responsible for retrieving and preparing the round for EOD disposal. Mitigating Short Rounds requires round inspection during the preparation phase and ensuring proper data is imputed before firing any round to ensure safe execution of training. Most Likely Risk : Slips, Trips, and Falls with Heavy EquipmentMitigation: Ensuring proper PPE is worn during operations and slowing down any nonessential movement to ensure soldiers move heavy equipment in and out of vehicle safely. Part of the mitigation will be to brief about weather conditions and empower soldiers to modify/clean any surface deem unsafe before and during the training event.
